clusters.description: The average daily social media usage is around 2 hours and 23 minutes, with users typically accessing 6.8 platforms monthly. Instagram outperforms TikTok in attracting unique visitors and total visits, with 16.5% preferring Instagram over TikTok's 7.4%. TikTok sessions, however, are longer, averaging nearly 6 minutes. In Singapore, 96% of the population uses the internet with a penetration rate for mobile connections at 162.2%. Social media usage is high, with 85% engagement and a steady increase in social media entities.

clusters.title: Teen Technology
clusters.description: The cluster highlights the pervasive use of technology and social media among teens. It reveals that 95% of UK youths aged 16-24 own smartphones, checking them every 12 minutes. Social media usage is high, with 81% of teens using platforms like YouTube, TikTok, and Instagram. A significant portion of teens use the internet almost constantly, with access to smartphones, computers, and gaming consoles varying by income level. The data also touches on online bullying, particularly affecting LGBTQ and transgender youth, and the influence of technology on teen dating.

merged_facts.merged_content: Smartphone and social media usage among teens: 95% of people aged 16 to 24 in the UK own a smartphone. 81% of teens use social media according to a 2018 report. 95% of teens have ever used YouTube. 67% of teens use TikTok. 62% of teens use Instagram. 59% of teens use Snapchat. 23% of teens use Twitter. 20% of teens use Twitch. 17% of teens use WhatsApp. 14% of teens use Reddit. 5% of teens use Tumblr. Facebook use among teens dropped from 71% in 2014-15 to 32% in 2022.

merged_facts.narrative: In the UK, smartphone ownership is nearly universal among those aged 16 to 24, with 95% having a device. Social media remains a significant part of teen life: 95% have used YouTube, while TikTok, Instagram, and Snapchat are also popular, used by 67%, 62%, and 59% respectively. Interest in platforms like Twitter, Twitch, and WhatsApp is lower, and Facebook's popularity has sharply declined from 71% in 2014-15 to just 32% in 2022.

clusters.title: Social Media
clusters.description: As of 2025, over 5.24 billion people globally use social media, reflecting a significant increase from previous years. Social networks like Facebook and TikTok maintain vast user bases, with Facebook reaching 3.065 billion users and TikTok achieving substantial ad reach worldwide. Internet usage is widespread, with 66% of the global population online, and social media is integral to daily life for many, including 73% of Americans. Africa and Asia have seen notable growth in internet and social media adoption. Social media is also a primary source of news for many, with diverse platforms reaching millions across different demographics.

clusters.title: Digital Advertising
clusters.description: In 2023, digital advertising dominated the market, with 70% of total ad spend directed towards digital channels. The global investment in digital ads reached nearly USD $720 billion, marking a significant increase as digital ad spend more than doubled over the past five years. A significant portion of digital ad budgets, over 80%, was allocated programmatically. Social media networks accounted for 58.9% of social media usage during this period.
